results.title: Les Visiteurs du Soir = the Devil's Envoys
results.brief_description:
The film is based on the 15th century French legend, wherein the Devil, disturbed by the encroaching forces of Good, sends his envoys to Earth to drive the citizens to despair. Dominique and Gilles appear at the court of Baron Hugues disguised as troubadours on the day Hugues celebrates the engagement of his daughter Anne to Renaud. Dominique seduces the Baron and persuades him to kill Renaud during a tournament. But Gilles and Anne fall in love. Furious to see his scheme thwarted by true love, the devil himself decides to intervene. Note: The antisemitic laws of the Vichy regime made it illegal for Trauner and Kosma (regular members of Carne’s crew) to work in the film industry. Their work on this film is uncredited. Francois Chaumette, Simone Signoret, Alain Resnais and Jean-Pierre Mocky appear as extras.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Marcel Carne ; writers, Jacques Prevert, Pierre Laroche ; photography, Roger Hubert ; music, Joseph Kosma, Maurice Thiriet ; art direction, Alexandre Trauner, Georges Wakhevitch, Leon Barsacq.
Cast: Arletty, Alain Cuny, Marie Dea, Jules Berry, Fernand Ledoux, Marcel Herrand, Roger Blin, Jean d’Yd.

results.title: Les Vacances de Monsieur Hulot = Mister Hulot's Holidays
results.brief_description:
Monsieur Hulot arrives at a Brittany seaside resort, where he inadvertently sparks a chain reaction of mishaps. By the time his vacation is over, Hulot is the object of disdain for everyone at the resort, with the exception of two adults and a group of children. Like Max Linder, Chaplin and Keaton, he [Tati] was an actor-auteur, and like them his comic style, based on sight gags, was universally exportable … With his tall, ungainly figure, and his signature raincoat, hat and pipe, Tati made Hulot the universal child-like innocent who creates chaos by ignoring adult rules … But Tati’s novelty was to combine slapstick with a modernist sensitivity. Formally, his films are extremely complex (and increasingly so, explaining his loss of favor after ‘Mon oncle’), exploiting to the full the possibilities of the frame and sound … His soundtracks, mixing noises, grunts, expletives, advertisements, snatches of songs and different languages, are the aural equivalent of Jean-Luc Godard ‘visual bricolage’. From the start, too, Tati’s films were a running commentary on the struggle between modernisation (or ‘Americanisation’) and tradition in France. ‘Les vacances de Monsieur Hulot’ was Tati’s second feature film and the first appearance of Monsieur Hulot who was to feature in all of Tati’s subsequent films.” Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. ‘The companion to French cinema’. BFI Publishing, 1996. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc 1953 ; Cannes Film Festival 1953-Prix de la Critique Internationale.

Credits: Producer, Fred Orain ; director, Jacques Tati ; script, Jacques Tati, Henri Marquet ; photography, Jacques Mercanton, Jean Mouselle ; music, Alain Romans.
Cast: Nathalie Pascaud, Michele Rolla, Raymond Carl, Lucien Fregis, Jacques Tati.

results.title: Les Trois Mousquetaires = the Three Musketeers (TV version)
results.brief_description:
In this live to air recording of the classic story by Alexandre Dumas, D’Artagnan, a young provincial noble, travels to Paris to join the musketeers. He meets action, love, hate, the king and the queen as his impetuousness gets him involved in political plots… and of course virile and indestructible friendship with the three musketeers Athos, Porthos and Aramis. A young Belmondo plays the dashing hero.

Credits: Director, Claude Barma ; writers, Claude Barma, Pierre Nivollet ; photography, Jacques Lemare ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Jean Chevrier, Daniel Sorano, Hubert Noel, Gaby Sylvia, Pierre Asso, Michel Galabru, Georges Descrieres, Bernard Dheran, Robert Hirsch, Michel Galabru.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 9
results.brief_description:
During the summer season Francois who works with the Mountain Guides Association is called to rescue mountain climbers. The mission is a sucees but Francois is mortally injured during the operation. To the general surprise, Marie returns to the village to attend Francois’ funerals.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 8
results.brief_description:
Janine and Henri are offered a job in Canada. Things are taking a turn for the worse at the village where opponents to the Landowners’ Union are being subjected to physical violence and intimidation.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 7
results.brief_description:
The workmen’s hut is blown up causing heavy damage to Flandin’s cafe. Lauzon’s Landowners Union comes under suspicion, thus aggravating the rift between Antoine and the Union.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 6
results.brief_description:
It’s winter again at Le Miroir. Robert Flandin is back on the slopes, fulfulling all the hopes Francois has invested in his career. Pierre is still refusing to go to University, instead making vague plans to become a farner like his father. The tension between father and son runs high and Pierre decides to leave to work in a ski factory.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 5
results.brief_description:
Antoine tries to talk sense into Lauzon but he remains inflexible and convices the members of the Landowners’ Union to refuse the offer made by the expropriation authority. As a result the break up between the men is inevitable and Francois and Maritine’s wedding is reported. Henri, the eldest of the Sesterain and the station’s project manager is asked to mediate.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 4
results.brief_description:
Pierre has, against all expectations, graduated from high school. Back at the village, he is offred to travel to Paris with Flandin, the local taxi driver, to help pick up a brand new ambulance. The party plans to stay at Flandin’s brother’s. Pierre becomes smitten with Marie, Flandin’s niece and invites her to spend the summer holidyas at Le Miroir.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga, Marie-Helene Breillat.

results.title: Les Sesterain Ou le Miroir 2000: Episode 3
results.brief_description:
The Council is starting to discuss land appropiation and one councillor is expressing his determination not to give up his land. Everybody is starting to realise that the soul of the village is about to be irretrievably destroyed. During the engagement ceremony of Francois and Martine (Lauzon’s daughter), Aunt Agathe dies. Lauzon who now stands to inherit large plots of land earmarked for appropriation becomes one of the staunches opponents to the resort.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Francois Villiers ; writers, Andre Maheux, Francois Villiers ; photography, Paul Soulignac, Henri Raichi ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Etienne Bierry, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Marie-Christine Barrault, Georges Claisse, Yves Lefebvre, Christian Alers, Marthe Villalonga.
